Posts.Content: Dec 26, 2007 01:06AM kjack wrote: I'd like to join the January girls!  Started rads December 6 after a lumpectomy for multifocal DCIS, and tomorrow is day 14 of 33.  I was red on day 4, onc nurse told me to use the aloe, but then I discovered I was allergic to it!!!  By Day 8 I had blisters, and the rad techs (who are angels) painted me with Castellani's paint to dry them up.  The pain went away, but the blisters continued. I did some research over the weekend, and found a product - Xclair - that was available locally with a prescription.  When I asked the rad tech about it, she said, "You mean the nurse didn't give you any samples of that?"  I was HOT!!!  The angel went and raided the nurse's drawer and made sure that I had what I needed.  Other than that, I'm doing pretty well physically.  Emotionally, I've had a few bad moments, but it seems to help to read what y'all are also doing to keep on keeping on!
